content: Some context first: I am working on a feature with breaking changes, I'd like to do a perf run to get an idea in the case where the feature is enabled by default.
I have migrated the compiler so that it compiles with the feature enabled and same for rust analyzer -- which failed on the last bors try
I'm wondering if the perf run will stop if it encouters a failure or will it still test rest of the tests in rust-perf?
If it won't stop can someone queue a perf test here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79696
Pr ci is green. I will queue a perf run.
